text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today, I got so many emails saying that they
loved the easy mode

Lego cake, so I wanted to make something else
that was easy mode.

And I got so many requests to do something
from Minecraft, specifically,

a Creeper! So today, we are gonna be making
Mint Chocolate Chip Creeper

Rice Krispy Treats! They’re super easy,
they only take like 10 minutes.

And here are the things you will need: Kelloggs
Rice Krispies cereal, you’ll

need 5 cups of this cereal, baking spray,
3 tablespoons of butter,

1/2 a teaspoon of peppermint extract, green
food coloring dye, a square

cookie cutter, this is 2-1/2 inches by 2-1/2
inches. 1 bag of mini

marshmallows, it’s a 10 ounce bag, and some
chocolate candy melts.

I’m using the color black, but if you can’t
find colored melts in the

color black, you can just melt regular chocolate.
Like Hershey chocolates

or those little kiss chocolates, just any
meltable chocolates.

Last but not least, 1 big rectangle baking
pan. This is 13 by 9 inches.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is take
your baking spray, and
spray the pan.

Ooop! It would be nice if it was pointed
the right direction!

Now we’re gonna take all of our ingredients
and head over to the stove,

and that’s where we’re gonna put everything
together!

I just found a medium pot, put it on the stove,
and I turned my burner to low.

And the first thing you’re gonna do is add
3 tablespoons of butter.

It’s actually not a lot of butter, 1 of
those big sticks is only 8 ounces,
so this is a little 3 ounce.

And you’re gonna put it in the pot, we are
gonna let the butter melt

completely to a low heat, it should only take
about a minute, it doesn’t take

too long. Now that our butter is all
melted, we are gonna add all

of the marshmallows! I’m just gonna cut
this open, meep-meep-meep-meep-meep!
And dump ‘em in!

Once you dump the marshmallows in, we’re
just gonna stir them until it all
becomes like, liquid and gooey. Yum-yum-yum!

The marshmallows melt pretty quickly on the
heat, so this should only take
about a minute, it’s really easy.

Once the marshmallows are all melted, we are
going to remove it from the heat,

put it onto a different burner, and then you’re
going to add your peppermint

extract and a little bit of green food coloring
dye.
Now we’re gonna add our 5 cups of Rice Krispies!

Now you’re gonna mix it all together, and
just be sure to stir really gently!

After you’ve mixed in all the Rice Krispies
treats, we are gonna put it in
the pan, it’s really really sticky!
Woo! There we go!

And now what you’re gonna do is take a piece
of wax paper, put it on top,

and press down. So that it fills to the size
of the pan.

Now that we got our Rice Krispy treats all
done, we’re gonna put them in

the fridge and let them chill for about 30
minutes.

While our Rice Krispies are cooling off in
the fridge, we are gonna make
our chocolate creeper faces!

The first thing that you’re gonna do, is
I printed out 6 little Creeper faces,

These are about 2-1/2 inches by 2-1/2 inches,
just like our square cookie

cutter. but you can do them any size that
you want to do.

And I’m just gonna stick them down on top
of this white cardboard and tape
them down with a little bit of scotch tape.

At the top, at the bottom! And now, you’re
gonna take a piece of wax paper,

put it right on top, and tape it down. Just
make sure it’s really flat…
There we go.

Now they’re all ready to put chocolate on
top of.

In this plastic bag I have melted black candy
melts, and this is a number

2 tip, and we’re just gonna trace out the
little eyeballs and the face.

Once you have your basic shape, you can also
use a little toothpick,

like this, and kind of jiggle it around, just
to make the chocolate
a little smoother.

When your chocolate Creeper faces are all
done, you’re just gonna set them

aside and let them cool, because the chocolates
still a little bit hot.

I just took the Rice Krispies out of the fridge
and I flopped them onto

this flat surface. And what we’re gonna
do is you’re gonna take

your square 2-1/2 inch by 2-1/2 inch cookie
cutter,
and just cut out all the shapes!

If you don’t have the cookie cutter, don’t
worry, you can just take a sharp

cutting knife and just cut the squares by
eyeballing it.

Line it up, push it down… Ow! Geez, maybe
I need some muscles here!

Ta-da! Our first Creeper! You’re just gonna
pop it out and continue
to cut the squares throughout the whole thing!

Now that we’ve got all of our Rice Krispies
cut out into little squares,

like so. We are gonna take the chocolate Creeper
faces and put ‘em on top.

I’ve cut out 1 of the little faces. I just
like to do it this way because

it’s a little bit easier, and chocolates
really easy to work with.

You just peel it off and place it on top of
your Rice Krispy wherever
you’d like.
Just kind of eyeballing it.
Aw! Look at our little Creeper!
He’s so cute!

Now we’re gonna do this to the rest of our
Rice Krispy Treatssssssssssssss.
See, because that was the Creeper Noise!

Ta-da! Here are the Mint Chocolate Chip Creeper
Rice Krispy Treats!

They look so cute! They look just like Creepers
ssssshould!

I hope you guys liked ‘em these were so
easy to make. They only take

about 10 minutes to bake, and then an additional
10 minutes to do the little

chocolate faces. So, thanks for suggesting
it.

And if you have any ideas for any Nerdy Nummies,
please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
OK, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
